item.title: Pakistan's first female central bank head Shamshad Akhtar dies
item.description: Shamshad Akhtar, the first and only woman to lead Pakistan's central bank and a two-time caretaker finance minister, died at 71, the finance ministry said on Saturday. Akhtar was serving as chairperson of the Pakistan Stock Exchange at the time of her death, giving her a rare role spanning Pakista

item.title: 30 NCP leaders urge Nahid Islam not to form alliance with Jamaat
item.description: Thirty leaders of the National Citizens Party (NCP) have written to party convener Nahid Islam, urging him not to form any political alliance with Jamaat-e-Islami, citing the party’s controversial historical role and recent divisive activities. The memorandum, delivered on Saturday, expresse

item.title: Protests continue over justice for Hadi
item.description: Protests demanding justice for Shaheed Sharif Osman bin Hadi, spokesperson of Inqilab Moncho, continued for the second consecutive day at Shahbagh in the capital on Saturday. Protesters, including women and children, joined the demonstration and chanted various slogans. As of 8:30 pm, demonstrato

item.title: BSF halts fence construction at Joypurhat border after BGB intervention
item.description: Indian Border Security Force (BSF) attempted to construct a barbed wire fence at the Ghonapara border in Panchbibi upazila of Joypurhat on Saturday morning, violating international border regulations, but were forced to stop after intervention by Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB). Early Saturday morni

item.title: Tarique visits Evercare again to see ailing mother
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman visited Evercare Hospital in the capital on Saturday night to see his ailing mother and former Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia. Tarique arrived at the hospital around 9:40pm, BNP media cell member Sayrul Kabir Khan said. This was the second time Tarique visited

item.title: Miraz’s Sylhet Titans pip Noakhali Express in last-ball BPL drama
item.description: Sylhet Titans edged past Noakhali Express in a thrilling match that went down to the very last ball in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL). Mehidy Hasan Miraz’s side secured a one-wicket victory in their backyard, surpassing Noakhali’s 143 with a leg bye on the final delivery on Saturd

item.title: Industry first in gas supply to fuel economic growth
item.description: Industrial consumers will get top priority in gas supply as the government prepares such a fuel-feeding recipe aimed at fuelling economic growth, now largely subdued following political upheavals, sources say. item.title: The political economy of nation-building
item.description: A textbook definition of the well-worn word ‘nation’ may denote ‘a group of people who share a common identity based on shared history, culture, tradition, custom, religion, language and a sense of unity or belonging together. Here, ‘nation’ is mostly

item.title: Alarming rise in suicides
item.description: The revelation that an average of around 40 people die by suicide every day in Bangladesh is a chilling indicator of a profound and largely unaddressed social crisis. Police records on unnatural deaths show that between 2020 and 2024, a total of 73,597 suicide cases were recorded. That means

item.title: BD-India trade in travel services
item.description: December is usually a month of holiday-making for most people in Bangladesh. A large number of people wait throughout the year for the month when they can travel home and abroad with their families and friends. item.title: Ensuring expeditions commercial justice
item.description: Amid a series of new laws and initiatives introduced recently by the interim government to ease public suffering and speed up the delivery of justice, the proposed Commercial Courts Ordinance 2025 stands out as a potentially transformative measure. item.title: Tarique thanks nation for warm welcome
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on Saturday expressed gratitude to the people of Bangladesh for their warm reception following his return to the country after 17 years abroad.
